intro: Denhamia fournieri subsp. drakeana, commonly known as the Drake's denhamia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
